learning_outcomes.description: Examine the roles of research and quality improvement (QI) in developing evidence-based practice to improve health care delivery.
Define a problem and set objectives for QI activities.
Explore appropriate methods for systematically gathering, analysing and interpreting data in QI activities.
Recognise considerations around data collection and reporting of outcomes of QI activities that promote ethical practice.
Examine methods of implementing change based on QI outcomes (implementation science) and how this approach can be used to improve evidence-based practice.

assessments.assessment_title: Literature Review | QI Project Plan | Audit tool
assessments.task_description: Students are required to select a clinical topic suitable to consider for a project based on quality improvement principles. This assessment requires you to review the current evidence on this topic and develop a project plan that includes undertaking an audit at the site of your placement. The project plan includes details on the aim of your project, your plan to undertake the audit and the audit (data collection) tool. The task sheet that contains the assessment details and the marking guide that will be used to grade this assessment are available on Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Upload to Turnitin via the Assessment page on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The aim of this assessment is for students to design a scientific digital poster that details their Quality Improvement project. The poster will provide the basis for the student's presentation in Week 13.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Poster PDF uploaded via Turnitin under Assessments in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
30/10/2025 - 31/10/2025

Students have been timetabled to a session in Week 13 on either Thursday or Friday. Sessions will be timetabled 8am - midday or 1pm-5pm. Students will be timetabled to one session only. These sessions are on campus at St Lucia.
assessments.task_description:
The aim of this assessment is for students to present their project: to describe contemporary evidence and local context, the audit undertaken, the analysis of the audit results and clinical recommendations based on the results within the framework of quality improvement principles. The students' poster will be displayed during the presentation.

Prepare a five (5) minute presentation that describes your QI project. You will also be required to answer several questions about your QI project (total presentation time 10 minutes).
assessments.submission_guidelines: This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Online Modules

There are a series of online modules in Blackboard that contain much of the learning content within the course and are designed to support you with developing a project idea and audit of practice. Students are encouraged to work through the modules steadily throughout the semester.


Learning outcomes: L01

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 11(28 Jul - 19 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Lecture series

There are a series of lectures across the semester as per the NUMW3101 timetable. All lectures are delivered live online and are recorded. Links to lectures will be posted on Blackboard. Lecture recordings will be uploaded to Blackboard alongside a pdf of the lecture slides.

learning_activities.topic:
Mentor (Tutorial) Groups

Students nominate a Mentor Group that will be facilitated by a Nursing/Midwifery lecturer. The Mentor Groups meet six times across the semester starting in Week 1. The Mentor Group sessions are discussion based and are designed to guide students in developing their project idea and placement audit.
